summary: KASICH claims during the debate in Milwaukee on March 29th, 2016 that he should be selected as the nominee in a contested convention for a couple of reasons.

KASICH claimed during the debate in Milwaukee on March 29th, 2016 that his program in Ohio has successfully brought money back to the state to solve problems. He argued that by providing medication and job opportunities to the mentally ill and drug addicted individuals in prisons, they can become taxpayers and save money for the state. He also stated that their program has resulted in an 80 percent success rate in preventing people from returning to prison and a recidivism rate of 27 percent.
